column8: This is the first McDonald's outside of the United States. See McDonald's Canada
First McDonald's in Latin America and in the Caribbean and the first McDonald's in a Hispanophone area. See McDonald's Puerto Rico

column2: U.S. Virgin Islands(territory of ﾂUnited States)

column4: San Josﾃｩ, 4th street, between 1st and Central Avenue.
column8: Third country (not U.S. possession) and first outlet outside North America where McDonald's opened. See McDonald's Costa Rica
First outlet in Oceania and first outlet outside the Americas. See McDonald's Australia. Locally known as Maccas.
First outlet in Asia, McDonald's Holdings Company Japan, Inc.[10] locally known as makku (・・・・・・・・ｯ). The most McDonald's in a country besides the United States. See McDonald's Japan
This was the first outlet in Europe. Opened in 1971 by European Master Franchisees Jan Sybesma McDonald's Europe ・・ Plan to open 15 more stores in the next 4 years. See McDonald's Netherlands

First outlet in West Germany opened in Munich-Obergiesing in 1971. McDonald's is locally known as Megges. First outlet in the new states of Germany opened in Plauen in 1990 following reunification. See McDonald's Germany

First outlet in Creteil in 1972 even though McDonald's officially recognizes the first outlet in Strasbourg in 1979. In 2019, France was the largest European market for the hamburger chain per investopedia.com. See McDonald's France.
First outlet in Scandinavia. See McDonald's Sweden

column3: England: November 13, 1974[17]Wales: December 3, 1984Scotland: November 23, 1987[18]Northern Ireland: October 12, 1991
column8: Includes Isle of Man and Jersey (1 each)England: 1,038Scotland: 95Wales: 62Northern Ireland: 26See McDonald's UK

column2: Hong Kong(ﾂBritish Hong Kong at the time)
column4: Paterson Street, Causeway Bay, Hong Kong Island. (CLOSED)[19]
column8: First outlet in a Chinese-speaking territory. Hong Kong was then a British Crown colony/Dependent Territory; McDonald's would open up a restaurant in China itself 15 years later. See McDonald's Hong Kong
First outlet in an independent country of the Caribbean.
Founded in New Zealand by Wally and Hugh Morris[21]First South Island restaurants opened at Linwood and Merivale, both Christchurch, on November 3, 1987.[22] See McDonald's New Zealand.
First drive-thru in Europe opened in Nutgrove, Dublin and first McCafﾃｩ in Europe Grafton Street, Dublin. See McDonald's Ireland
First outlet opened in Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro, in 1979. First outlet opened in South America and first outlet in a lusophone country. Locally known as Mﾃｩqui. See McDonald's Brazil
First outlet in Southeast Asia. All Singaporean McDonald's locations are certified halal. See McDonald's Singapore[23]
First outlet in the Iberian Peninsula. See McDonald's Spain

column4: Nicanor Reyes Street, Morayta, Sampaloc, Manila

column8: Oldest surviving outlet in a Muslim-majority country. See McDonald's Malaysia
All restaurants were temporarily closed in 1992 during investigations of restaurant bombings in Taiwan; they reopened after investigations had concluded. See McDonald's Taiwan
Guantanamo Bay; open only to military personnel. Not accessible for Cuban citizens.
First outlet opened in East Thrace; outlets in Anatolia would open later. Also first outlet in the Turkic-speaking world, with Azerbaijan coming second at 1999. See McDonald's Turkey

column2: Macau( Portuguese Macau at the time)
column4: Rua do Campo, Cathedral Parish, Macau Peninsula
column8: Then Portuguese territory; McDonald's would only open a restaurant in Portugal itself 4 years later. see List of restaurants.
First outlet in a communist country (not communist anymore) and first outlet in the Balkans. See McDonald's Serbia
Second communist country, first Warsaw Pact member, thus first outlet behind the Iron Curtain. Locally known as Meki. See McDonald's Hungary

column2: Russia(part of ﾂSoviet Union at the time)
column8: First outlet in the Soviet Union itself, which then disintegrated 23 months after its opening. See McDonald's Russia
First branch in Sarinah closed in 2020 due to refurbishment of Sarinah itself.[32] See McDonald's Indonesia
First McDonald's outlet to open after the Cold War. See McDonald's Czech Republic

column4: Marszaﾅ・kowska Street, Warsaw in department store "ezam"D

column8: First outlet in Africa and the first outlet in the Arab World; McDonald's is now present in all continents except Antarctica. See McDonald's Morocco

column2: Northern Mariana Islands(territory of ﾂUnited States)
column8: First outlet opened on the island of Saipan; second outlet opened in 1997
First outlet in the Middle East. See McDonald's Israel.
First outlet in the Arabian Peninsula. See McDonald's Saudi Arabia McDonald's Saudi Arabia

column5: 35 (excl. seasonal restaurants) 40 (including seasonal and mobile restaurants)

column8: First outlet in the Baltics. See McDonald's Latvia
First outlet in Southern Africa. See McDonald's South Africa

column2: Samoa(named Western Samoa at the time)

column8: As of April 2012, Fiji was the only country in the world to still use the 2003 "i'm lovin' it" packaging as the other countries are using the 2008 packaging for meals and items. See McDonald's Fiji
First outlet in South Asia. See McDonald's India
Country with the second most locations of McDonald's in the Caribbean, after Puerto Rico. See McDonald's Dominican Republic

First McDonald's in a non-Baltic former Soviet republic (not including Russia)
The company claimed this as McDonald's "100th country" although this calculation included many non-sovereign territories. See McDonald's Belarus
McDonald's previously had stores in Trinidad (May 6, 1997 ・・ October 25, 2003) but closed due to low sales. Re-opened at The Falls at West Mall in 2011 and has expanded to 5 other locations.[41]
All three restaurants in the peninsula of Crimea were closed in 2014. See McDonald's Ukraine

column2: Guernsey and the ﾂJersey ( British Crown dependency)
Isle of Man ( British Crown dependency)

column8: McDonald's outlets ceased operation during the Nicaraguan Civil War and re-established a presence in 1998 after an absence of two decades. During the civil war one continued operating as "Donald's".[42] See McDonald's Nicaragua
See McDelivery Lebanon, which is currently merged with its official website as local franchisee Miknas Food S.A.L. is gradually reforming their McDonald's store chain
First outlet in the Caucasus. See McDonald's Georgia
One location in Baghdad for the U.S. Army, but there is also a knockoff called MaDonal.
After some 10 years of trying to enter the Bosnian market with no success, McDonald's opened its first restaurant in Bosnia on July 20, 2011. See McDonald's Bosnia and Herzegovina
First contemporary McDonald's location in a communist country. See McDonald's Vietnam
First outlet in Central Asia. See McDonald's Kazakhstan
